attributes.action: Government should pass a Bill to punish bullying in school as a serious crime.
attributes.additional_details:
Schools are closing eye on bullying. Fines( level 5 standard scale )to be put in place or making it an indictable offence. 
Is a long term trauma for children and later as adults. This is something that cannot continue and not be treated as a serious crime. It has a massive impact on our children and on us as parent/s.
Government should consider bullying in schools as a serious crime and reduce it considerably by passing a Bill to specifically punishing it. Exclusions does not stop bullying.
attributes.background:
A Bill should be passed to punish bullying in schools as a serious crime. Bullying in schools should be considered a serious criminal offence and sanctioned accordingly. 
Government should pass a Bill as bullying in schools has become too frequent and not been dealt with as to stop it.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for  similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608952
